Crimson Pact.name: Crimson Pact
Crimson Pact.blurb: Every 40 points of bonus Health gives Vladimir 1 Ability Power and every 1 point of Ability Power gives Vladimir 1.4 bonus Health (does not stack with itself).
Crimson Pact.description: Innate: Vladimir gains (2.5% bonus health)  bonus ability power and (140% AP)  bonus health. These two bonuses do not stack with each other.
Crimson Pact.notes:
* Crimson Pact's bonus ability power stacks multiplicatively with other sources of % ability power but its bonus health stacks additively with other sources of bonus health. Examples on how they calculate below:
Case 1: With  Rabadon's Deathcap you get a total of (40% AP + 3.5% bonus health) bonus ability power and (196% AP + 1.4% bonus health) bonus health.
Case 2: With  Cinderhulk you get a total of (2.875% bonus health) bonus ability power and (140% AP + 15% bonus health) bonus health.
Case 3: With  Rabadon's Deathcap +  Cinderhulk you get a total of (40% AP + 4.025% bonus health) bonus ability power and (196% AP + 16.61% bonus health) bonus health.

Transfusion.name: Transfusion
Transfusion.blurb: Vladimir steals life from the target enemy. When Vladimir's resource is full, Transfusion will benefit from massively increased damage and healing for a brief time.
Transfusion.description: Active: Vladimir drains the lifeforce of the target enemy, dealing  magic damage and  healing himself.
Transfusion.description2: Each cast of Transfusion generates a stack of  Bloodthirst over its  cooldown, which is displayed in his secondary resource bar. At 2 stacks, Vladimir gains Crimson Rush for 2.5 seconds and  10% bonus movement speed for 0.5 seconds.
Transfusion.description3: Crimson Rush: The next Transfusion deals 85% increased damage and heals for an additional 30 − 200 (based on level) (+ 5% (+ 4% per 100 AP) missing health), reduced to 35% against minions.
Transfusion.notes:
* Even thought the healing effect is visualized as a projectile, the healing itself triggers instantly.
 Vladimir's resource bar changes colors depending on Bloodthirst's charge-up.
 White while generating the first stack and while at 1 stack (there is no time-out period).
 Orange while generating the second stack.
 Red while Crimson Rush is active (Bloodthirst will deplete over 2.5 seconds once triggered).

 Each stack generates over-time (Transfusion's cooldown).

 During  Tides of Blood or  Sanguine Pool, Crimson Rush is maintained for the duration of the ability.
  Bloodthirst is slowly depleted during this time.

Sanguine Pool.name: Sanguine Pool
Sanguine Pool.blurb: Vladimir sinks into a pool of blood, becoming untargetable for 2 seconds. Additionally, enemies on the pool are slowed and Vladimir siphons life from them.
Sanguine Pool.description: Active: Vladimir sinks into a pool of blood, gaining  37.5% bonus movement speed which decays exponentially over 1 second and becoming  untargetable and  ghosted for 2 seconds.
Sanguine Pool.description2: Enemies who stand upon the pool are  slowed by 40% and dealt magic damage every half second, while Vladimir  heals himself for 15% of Sanguine Pool's damage dealt.
Sanguine Pool.description3: Vladimir cannot use basic attacks or abilities during Sanguine Pool.
Sanguine Pool.notes:
* The first tick damages immediately so the final one occurs 0.5 seconds before Vladimir becomes targetable again.
 The  slow ends immediately once affected enemies get out of range.
 Sanguine Pool has no  cast time.
 Vladimir may still use summoner spells and active items during Sanguine Pool.

Tides of Blood.name: Tides of Blood
Tides of Blood.blurb: Vladimir pays his own health to charge up a reservoir of blood which, when released, deals damage in the area around him but can be blocked by enemy units.
Tides of Blood.description: First Cast: Vladimir winds up for up to 1.5 seconds,  slowing himself by 20% over the last 0.5 seconds. If Vladimir finishes charging or is  interrupted, he automatically initiates the second cast.
Tides of Blood.description2: Second Cast: Vladimir unleashes a nova of blood bolts, each of which collide with the first enemy they hit, dealing them magic damage that is increased the longer Tides of Blood was charged, up to the first second.
Tides of Blood.description3: If Tides of Blood was charged for at least 1 second, affected enemies are also  slowed for 0.5 seconds.
Tides of Blood.description4: Enemies can intercept multiple bolts, but may only be damaged once.

Hemoplague.name: Hemoplague
Hemoplague.blurb: Vladimir infects an area with a virulent plague. Affected enemies take increased damage for the duration. After a few seconds, Hemoplague deals magic damage to infected enemies and heals Vladimir for each enemy Champion hit.
Hemoplague.description: Active: Vladimir infects all enemies in the target area with a virulent plague, increasing the damage they take from all sources by 10% for 4 seconds, after which all infected enemies take magic damage.
Hemoplague.description2: The detonation brings the blood from  enemy champions hit to Vladimir,  healing him for the pre-mitigation damage dealt against them once the blood reaches him, reduced to 50% after the first.
Hemoplague.notes:
* Hemoplague has no cast time and doesn't affect Vladimir's previous orders.
 Hemoplague will amplify almost all sources and types of damage (including damage from neutral monsters but excluding  true damage, with percent modifiers stacking multiplicatively).
 Hemoplague amplifies itself for an actual 165 / 220 / 275 / 330 / 385 (+ 77% AP) damage.
